name: Level II Tier QA & Compliance Checklist
description: Continuous Quality Improvement (CQI) Add-on for milestone schools
introduction: Congratulations! Your program has reached an exciting milestone and will now be reviewed with a Continuous Quality Improvement (CQI) checklist. This achievement reflects your hard work, passion, and commitment to excellence.

sections.name: Physical Environment: Health & Safety
sections.description: Protecting children and staff from harm while supporting their health and well-being in a secure space to play, learn and grow.

items.label: Environment is clean, safe, and well-maintained including all restrooms, and the exterior of the building
Ground cover is adequate, fencing in good repair, toys and equipment in good supply and free of rust/mildew
Carabiners in place on fencing, no evidence of tripping hazards and at least one shade structure
Wood mulch is at least 9" deep, and shredded/recycled rubber where used is at least 6" deep and maintained
Playgrounds include a variety of equipment with no rust, no sharp edges
Air vents, rugs, windows, and floors are clean/dust-free
Emergency procedures are posted and practiced regularly to include required drill logs
Secure entry system, wi-fi and video monitoring are operational
First-Aid kits are complete with no expired products
Menus are current and posted
The laundry room is clean, organized, odor-free, and locked
Handwashing, diapering and sanitation routines are consistently followed
The bus/van(s) are properly maintained, clean, mechanically sound, with fire extinguisher and first-aid kit
The kitchen is clean, reflects state requirements and with the door closed
Safe sleep practices across all areas in the infant room are followed
Allergy lists are visible and updated monthly with cover sheet for confidentiality
Vehicles are current on all requirements to include the annual mechanical inspection
Infant bottles are properly labeled
Staff belongings are stored out of reach in all classrooms
All cribs and infant equipment are clean and well maintained
Infants don't sleep in equipment other than safety-approved cribs spaced with 36" corridor and head-to-toe arrangement
Transportation log book and verifiable training for those who drive the bus is in place

sections.name: Relationships and Interactions
sections.description: Helping children feel safe, valued and connected, building trust and supporting healthy learning and development.

items.label: Caregivers are warm, responsive, and nurturing
Staff communication is respectful and sensitive
The classroom/organizational climate is calm, flexible, and cheerful, representing cohesive teams
Positive guidance supports behavior

sections.name: Curriculum, Learning, and Teaching Practices
sections.description: Guiding what children learn, how they are taught and ways staff support growth to build skills for school and life.

items.label: Balance of child-initiated and teacher-guided activities is provided with ongoing close supervision
Bulletin boards are current and reflect the monthly theme
Children have opportunities for exploration, play, and problem-solving
Supports are available for dual language learners with one staff on site able to communicate as needed
Lesson plans are individualized using observation and assessment
Families have an opportunity to participate (for a fee) in specialty classes

sections.name: Classroom Environment
sections.description: Safe, welcoming, and well-organized where children explore, learn, and build positive relationships with caregivers and peers.

items.label: Classrooms are organized, inviting and clutter-free
Learning centers (blocks, dramatic play, literacy/language, arts, science, sensory, music, cultural) are well stocked and in good condition
Anti-bias books and culturally diverse dolls are present in at least some classrooms
School-age classroom has materials unique to the age group, encouraging reasoning and critical thinking
Children's process-art work is at child's eye-level, displayed throughout reflective of Chroma's theme-based learning
Staff bios with photos are posted to encourage connection and trust
Classroom shelves labeled with photos reflecting a print-rich environment supporting literacy and independence
Classroom doors are creatively decorated that uniquely showcase the age group
Special displays are based on events and seasons of the calendar
Comfortable and inviting quiet spaces are available for children who need downtime

sections.name: Child Assessment & Individualization
sections.description: Practices help teachers understand individual strengths, needs, and progress to support learning for all.

items.label: Ongoing observation and documentation of child progress occurs with child portfolios
Developmental screenings are completed with family input (Ages & Stages Questionnaire)
Assessments guide adaptations to learning experiences where needed and possible according to staffing
Family conferences are available to all who want

sections.name: Professionalism
sections.description: Conduct, behavior, and attitude reflect respect, competence, and integrity fostering collaboration and excellence.

items.label: Interactions support all learning styles with consistent boundaries but positive behavior reinforcement
All staff adhere to the Chroma dress code
Program has low staff turnover
Opening and Closing checklists are being used daily
Management plans and delivers staff meetings at least every month/quarter

sections.name: Family & Community Engagement
sections.description: Established and maintained collaborative relationships that support learning.

items.label: Orientation for new families includes a personal meeting with follow up communication, setting tone for success
Parent Surveys are offered to families at least annually for anonymous feedback
The program provides regular, two-way communication with families through Procare
Families have opportunities for involvement (events, volunteering, etc.)
Family culture, language, and values are respected
Program connects families with community resources (electronically/print) as needed or requested

sections.name: Equity, Inclusion & Diversity
sections.description: Policies and procedures ensure every child feels valued, respected, and supportedâ€”laying the foundation for lifelong learning and belonging.

items.label: Program practices are inclusive for children of all abilities with supports as available for those in need
Learning centers represent diverse cultures, languages, ability/non-traditional gender roles/family structures

sections.name: Leadership/Lobby/Office/Hallways and Files
sections.description: Management effectively guides staff, children, and families with the Chroma vision where everyone can thrive, including outstanding recordkeeping.

items.label: The lobby, office, hallways, and front desk are tidy, inviting, professional, and reflective of Chroma branding
Required posted notices are in place
Management creates and distributes monthly newsletters to families also posted on Parent Information Boards
Music is softly, but noticeably playing in the lobby
Prior to classroom transition, families are notified and plan in place for seamless transition
GA PreK files are complete and with checklists
Child and Staff Files include checklists and are kept in a locked cabinet
Current version of DECAL Rules and Regulations are available for review by staff or parents
